snippet: The Protestant leader who vowed never to compromise with Irish Catholic nationalists accepted in his twilight a power-sharing agreement after decades of sectarian violence.
abstract: Rev Ian Paisley, Northern Ireland's firebrand Protestant leader, dies at age 88; he vowed never to compromise with Irish Catholic nationalists but, in his twilight years, accepted a power-sharing agreement after decades of sectarian violence.

byline.contributor: Douglas Dalby contributed reporting from Dublin.

lead_paragraph: The Protestant leader who vowed never to compromise with Irish Catholic nationalists accepted in his twilight a power-sharing agreement after decades of sectarian violence.

headline.main: Ian Paisley Dies at 88; Longtime Voice of Hard-Line Ulster Who Then Made Peace
headline.print_headline: Ian Paisley Dies at 88; Longtime Voice of Hard-Line Ulster Who Then Made Peace
